rules.title: System must use encryption to protect audit tools
rules.description: Prevent modification of audit tools to hide activities

rules.title: System must not have systemd-timesyncd package installed
rules.description: Inaccurate time makes it difficult to correlate events and analyze

rules.title: System must not have ntp package installed
rules.description: NTP is no longer recommended, vulnerable to attacks and lacks accuracy

rules.title: System must not have telnetd package installed
rules.description: Telnet transmits passwords in plaintext, easy to sniff and exploit

rules.title: System must not have rsh-server package installed
rules.description: RSH transmits passwords in plaintext, similar to telnet

rules.title: OS must install AIDE for integrity checking
rules.description: Ensure detection of errors or intrusion file system changes

rules.title: Configure AIDE to perform integrity checks
rules.description: Ensure system detects unauthorized changes

rules.title: AIDE must use default script to run periodically
rules.description: Ensure continuous automatic checking

rules.title: AIDE must send alerts when baseline is changed
rules.description: Prevent configuration changes from being missed

rules.title: OS must store failure events using rsyslog
rules.description: Ensure logs are maintained for forensics and recovery

rules.title: Must install a firewall application (UFW)
rules.description: Need host-based firewall to automatically control remote access methods

rules.title: Uncomplicated Firewall (UFW) must be in active state
rules.description: Inactive firewall leaves all ports open, very high risk of remote attacks

rules.title: Must install auditd service
rules.description: auditd is core component for real-time security event logging

rules.title: Auditd service must be enabled and active at boot
rules.description: If auditd not running, lose entire audit trail

rules.title: Audispd must offload audit records to remote server
rules.description: Local logs easily deleted/tampered when system compromised

rules.title: OS must install apparmor package
rules.description: Without AppArmor, system vulnerable to uncontrolled program exploitation

rules.title: OS must be configured to use AppArmor
rules.description: Missing AppArmor removes critical protection layer against unwanted programs

rules.title: OS must install chrony package for time synchronization
rules.description: Ensure system time is accurately synchronized for logging and event analysis

rules.title: OS must install SSH (OpenSSH server)
rules.description: Protect network communications with encryption, replacing insecure protocols (telnet, rsh)

rules.title: OS must use SSH to protect confidentiality and integrity of information
rules.description: Ensure all information is encrypted during transmission, preventing data exposure

rules.title: OS must configure SSH daemon to use FIPS 140-3 approved ciphers
rules.description: Ensure SSH only uses strong FIPS-approved ciphers to protect data

rules.title: OS must configure SSH daemon to use FIPS 140-3 approved MACs
rules.description: Ensure SSH uses HMAC-SHA2 MACs to protect integrity; weak MACs are vulnerable to attacks

rules.title: SSH server must use only FIPS-validated key exchange algorithms
rules.description: Ensure SSH only uses strong FIPS-validated key exchange algorithms to prevent downgrade attacks

rules.title: OS must accept PIV credentials (CAC/smart card) - install opensc-pkcs11
rules.description: Enable CAC/smart card authentication (DoD requirement), strengthen public key security

rules.title: OS must require authentication when booting into single-user or maintenance mode
rules.description: Prevent attacker from accessing root shell in single-user mode without password

rules.title: OS must be configured to prevent APT from installing patches, service packs, device drivers
rules.description: Ensure software integrity, prevent installation of tampered software or malware from untrusted sources

rules.title: OS must enforce delay of at least four seconds between login prompts following a failed login
rules.description: Delay slows down brute-force process, reducing attacker opportunity to crack password without affecting legitimate logins

rules.title: OS must be configured so PAM prohibits use of cached authentications after one day
rules.description: Limit cached credentials usage time to ensure validity and reduce risk of using stale information
